result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angelo Harris

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Motion to Suppress Evidence, filed.

Defendant Angelo Harris in court.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Angelo Harris.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Pretrial conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the state. Defense requests motion hearing date be set.  Court sets deadline of 10/19/2022 for filing of Defense's motion and deadline of 11/8/2022 for filing of State's response.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-28-22, filed
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-28-22, filed.

Defendant Angelo Harris in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State, but does need additional discovery items.  Court sets deadline of 8/19/2022 for the State to turnover all remaining discovery.

Matter adjourned to Br. 9 for continued Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-8-22, filed.

Defendant Angelo Harris in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-23-22
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 5-17-22
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Amended Violation Report 4-26-22

Defendant Angelo Harris in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  John J Rejowski appeared for Jon Josephsen for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court due to being notified of a Justice Point violation. Court gave the defendant a verbal admonishment. Case is left on for preliminary hearing in preliminary court on May 24th, 2022 at 8:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 4-26-22
Court orders the previously forfeited $100 signature bond to be reinstated. Bond is set at $5,000 signature bond.

Defendant Angelo Harris in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE RECALLED. Defendant now in court for hearing. Court ordered the $100 signature bond reinstated and VACATED the warrant. Court REINSTATED Justice Point and ordered defendant to go directly to Justice Point after court hearing. Court orders the case to remain scheduled for preliminary hearing IN PERSON.
Court ordered $100.00 of the $5,000.00 signature bond forfeited.

Attorney Jason A Findling in court.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail bond hearing. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court further orders that $100.00 of the signature bond bail is forfeited. Court ordered the preliminary hearing date left on for May 24th, 2022 at 8:30 am.
Email correspondence with parties. Case scheduled for bail review hearing on 04/26/2022 at 08:15 am, Br 16.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Discharge Report 4-19-22
All previous bail conditions remain in full force and effect.

Case recalled:
Defendant Angelo Harris in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a return on warrant. Court lifts warrant. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to  Judge Stark, Branch 17. Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 5000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Jason A Findling in court.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court further orders that bail is forfeited. Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 4-15-22, Filed.
Pretrial Services Violation Report 4-12-22, Filed

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Angelo Harris in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Angelo Harris in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Angelo Harris appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
